summary.title: Bedrohungsmodell - OTT Auth
summary.description: Die Firma Allsecure betreibt unterschiedliche Anwendungen mit Hilfe einer 2-Faktorauthentifizierung via One-time token, der an das entsprechende Smartphone des Nutzers geschickt wird.

data.name:
Login System -
Webapp +
Mobile App
data.description: Vergleicht eingegebenen OTT-Wert auf Telefon mit erwartetem OTT seitens 2-Faktor-Dienst.

threats.title: Keine Redundanzen im Login Systeme
threats.description:
Angreifer macht einen DDoS-Angriff auf das Login System, sodass sich keiner mehr einloggen kann. Er tut dies indem ein Botnetz Syn Flooding betreibt und damit tausende halboffene TCP-Verbindungen erstellt. Das ist besonders effektiv, da keinerlei Redundanzen gegeben sind.

CAPEC-482: TCP Flood

Taktik-ID: T1498.001:
Adversaries may attempt to cause a denial of service (DoS) by directly sending a high-volume of network traffic to a target. This DoS attack may also reduce the availability and functionality of the targeted system(s) and network. Direct Network Floods are when one or more systems are used to send a high-volume of network packets towards the targeted service's network. Almost any network protocol may be used for flooding. Stateless protocols such as UDP or ICMP are commonly used but stateful protocols such as TCP can be used as well.

Dread=
Damage: 8
Reproducibility: 9
Exploitability: 6
Affected users: 10
Discoverability: 1
threats.mitigation:
1. Vernünftiges Filtern für den Login aufbauen. z.B. Whitelists, event detection
2. Entsprechende Filtermechanismen vor kritische Infrastruktur schalten, um nicht komplett Handlungsunfähig zu sein.
3. Damage, Reproducibility, Exploitability und Affected users sinken
4. D3-NTF
5. 11.1.4 Verify that the application has anti-automation controls to protect against
excessive calls such as mass data exfiltration, business logic requests, file
uploads or denial of service attacks.
6.

threats.title: Registrierte Emails rausfinden
threats.description:
Fehlermeldungen geben Auskunft über registrierte Email-Adressen
CAPEC-212: Functionality Misuse

Taktik-ID: T1589.002
Adversaries may gather email addresses that can be used during targeting. Even if internal instances exist, organizations may have public-facing email infrastructure and addresses for employees.

Adversaries may easily gather email addresses, since they may be readily available and exposed via online or other accessible data sets (ex: Social Media or Search Victim-Owned Websites). Email addresses could also be enumerated via more active means (i.e. Active Scanning), such as probing and analyzing responses from authentication services that may reveal valid usernames in a system. For example, adversaries may be able to enumerate email addresses in Office 365 environments by querying a variety of publicly available API endpoints, such as autodiscover and GetCredentialType.

Dread=
Damage: 5
Reproducibility: 10
Exploitability: 8
Affected users: 8
Discoverability: 4
threats.mitigation:
1. Möglichst allgemeine Fehlermeldungen erstellen
2. Überall wo es für den Nutzer ersichtlich ist, möglichst allgemeine Fehlermeldungen verwenden und wenn nötig, sensible Meldungen ins Backend legen und dort loggen
3. Discoverability, Exploitability und Reproducibility sinken
4.
5. 7.4.1 Verify that a generic message is shown when an unexpected or security
sensitive error occurs, potentially with a unique ID which support personnel
can use to investigate.
6.

threats.title: SQL Injections
threats.description:
Keine Inputvalidierung des eingegebenen Nutzernamens. Es wird einfach so in die Log-DB geschrieben.

CAPEC-66
threats.mitigation:
1. Nutzen von Input validierung und/oder stored procedures, um injections zu vermeiden
2. Mithilfe von Pentesting schwachstellen an der Datenbank schnittstelle finden und danach beseitigen
3.
4. D3-DQSA
5. 5.3.4 Verify that data selection or database queries (e.g. SQL, HQL, ORM, NoSQL)
use parameterized queries, ORMs, entity frameworks, or are otherwise
protected from database injection attacks
6. MASVS-CODE-4

threats.title: Statisches OTT für jeden Nutzer gleich
threats.description:
Angreifer könnte statisches Token klauen und es für unerlaubtes Einloggen bei Accounts verwenden, wo das PW bekannt ist.

CAPEC-633

Taktik-ID: T1134.001 
Adversaries may duplicate then impersonate another user's existing token to escalate privileges and bypass access controls. For example, an adversary can duplicate an existing token using DuplicateToken or DuplicateTokenEx. The token can then be used with ImpersonateLoggedOnUser to allow the calling thread to impersonate a logged on user's security context, or with SetThreadToken to assign the impersonated token to a thread.

Dread=
Damage: 10
Reproducibility: 6
Exploitability: 2
Affected users: 10
Discoverability: 8
threats.mitigation:
1. OTTs und Credentials allgemein immer mal wieder wechseln.
2. Policy einführen, dass Credentials sich ab und zu ändern.
3. Reproducibility, Affected users sinken
4. D3-CRO; Credential Rotation
5. 2.10.1 Verify that intra-service secrets do not rely on unchanging
credentials such as passwords, API keys or shared accounts
with privileged access.
6.

threats.title: Privat Key zum Signieren gestohlen
threats.description:
Angreifer ist irgendwie in den Besitz des Privat Keys zum Signieren der Excel-Sheets gekommen und erstellt nun manipulierte Tabellen fürs Management

CAPEC-474

Taktik-ID: T1649
Adversaries may steal or forge certificates used for authentication to access remote systems or resources. Digital certificates are often used to sign and encrypt messages and/or files. Certificates are also used as authentication material. For example, Azure AD device certificates and Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS) certificates bind to an identity and can be used as credentials for domain accounts.

Dread=
Damage: 10
Reproducibility: 4
Exploitability: 2
Affected users: 3
Discoverability: 5
threats.mitigation:
1. Trusted Hardware Modul verwenden um Schlüssel aufzubewahren
2. Durch Verwendung von THMs wird sichergestellt, dass nahezu niemand mehr die Schlüssel lesen kann. Bei erfolgreich-versuchter Entwendung löscht sich der Schlüssel selbst.
3. Exploitability geht runter, aber Damage bleibt hoch.
4. D3-TBI 
5. 2.9.1: Verify that cryptographic keys used in verification are stored
securely and protected against disclosure, such as using a Trusted
Platform Module (TPM) or Hardware Security Module (HSM), or an
OS service that can use this secure storage.
6. MASVS-RESILIENCE-1

threats.title: Nicht verschlüsselte Datenverbindung zum Export -> MITM
threats.description:
Angreifer kann einen MITM-Angriff zwischen DB und Export starten und alle Logs mitlesen.

CAPEC-94

Taktik-ID: T1557
Adversaries may attempt to position themselves between two or more networked devices using an adversary-in-the-middle (AiTM) technique to support follow-on behaviors such as Network Sniffing, Transmitted Data Manipulation, or replay attacks (Exploitation for Credential Access). By abusing features of common networking protocols that can determine the flow of network traffic (e.g. ARP, DNS, LLMNR, etc.), adversaries may force a device to communicate through an adversary controlled system so they can collect information or perform additional actions.

Dread=
Damage: 3
Reproducibility: 5
Exploitability: 3
Affected users: 10
Discoverability: 8
threats.mitigation:
1. Datenverkehr zwischen DB und Exportdienst verschlüsseln.
2. Durch gute/aktuelle verschlüsselung wird verhindert, dass Daten beim Export aus der Datenbank einfach mitgelesen werden können.
3. Reproducibility und Exploitability sinken
4. Encrypted Channel - T1573
5. 1.9.1 Verify the application encrypts communications between components,
particularly when these components are in different containers, systems,
sites, or cloud providers.
6. MASVS-NETWORK-1

threats.title: Zugriff auf Logs mit falschen rechten
threats.description:
Angreifer kann Logs beliebig manipulieren, da Permissions nicht richtig gesetzt sind.

CAPEC-93

Taktik-ID: T1565.001
Adversaries may insert, delete, or manipulate data at rest in order to influence external outcomes or hide activity, thus threatening the integrity of the data. By manipulating stored data, adversaries may attempt to affect a business process, organizational understanding, and decision making.

Dread=
Damage: 4
Reproducibility: 7
Exploitability: 8
Affected users: 0
Discoverability: 10
threats.mitigation:
1. Vernünftige Config des Log-Systems erstellen mit "Principle of least privilege"
2. Nur absolut notwendige Rechte an Nutzer verteilen und nicht einfach ohne Grund adminrechte erheben auf accounts, die nicht ausreichend gesichert sind.
3. Exploitability und Damage sinken stark, da man nicht mehr so viel machen kann wie vorher.
4. D3-LFP: Local File Permissions
5. 1.4.5 Verify that attribute or feature-based access control is used whereby the code
checks the user's authorization for a feature/data item rather than just their
role. Permissions should still be allocated using roles.
6.

threats.title: Passwörter nur gehashed ohne salt&pepper
threats.description:
Es ist möglich gehashte Passwörder wiederzubekommen durch Dictionary-Attacks oder RainbowTables, wenn das Passwort nur gehashed ist.

CAPEC-16

Taktik-ID: T1110.002

Adversaries may use password cracking to attempt to recover usable credentials, such as plaintext passwords, when credential material such as password hashes are obtained. OS Credential Dumping can be used to obtain password hashes, this may only get an adversary so far when Pass the Hash is not an option. Further, adversaries may leverage Data from Configuration Repository in order to obtain hashed credentials for network devices.

Dread=
Damage: 10
Reproducibility: 9
Exploitability: 4
Affected users: 10
Discoverability: 8
threats.mitigation:
1. Salt/Pepper auf Passwörter vor Hash
2. Es ist immer eine gute Idee Passwörter in der Datenbank zu Hashen, allerdings kann es bei schwachen Passwörtern sehr schnell dazu kommen, dass, wenn der Hash in die Hände eines Angreifers gerät, mithilfe einer Dictionary-Attack , das Passwort erraten werden kann.
3. Damage, Affected users sinken massiv
4.
5. 2.4.1 Verify that passwords are stored in a form that is resistant to offline
attacks. Passwords SHALL be salted and hashed using an approved
one-way key derivation or password hashing function. Key
derivation and password hashing functions take a password, a salt,
and a cost factor as inputs when generating a password hash
6. MASVS-CRYPTO: Cryptography

threats.title: Spear Phishing im Management
threats.description:
Angreifer gibt sich z.B. als Chef der IT-Abteilung aus, um an Excel-Log-Datei zu kommen.

CAPEC-163

Taktik-ID: T1598
Adversaries may send phishing messages to elicit sensitive information that can be used during targeting. Phishing for information is an attempt to trick targets into divulging information, frequently credentials or other actionable information. Phishing for information is different from Phishing in that the objective is gathering data from the victim rather than executing malicious code.

Dread=
Damage: 8
Reproducibility: 3
Exploitability: 2
Affected users: 2
Discoverability: 3
threats.mitigation:
1. Automatisches überprüfen der Email
2. Die Email wird gegen eine whitelist gechecked und nur dann weitergeleitet, wenn diese draufsteht. Ansonsten wird die email für manuelle review an einen Mitarbeiter gegeben
3. Senkung von Reproducibility und Discovery, da man seltener auf Phishing reinfällt
4. Identifier Analysis -> D3-ID

threats.title: Standard Passwort für SIEM verwendet
threats.description:
Das verwendete SIEM wurde nicht zu 100% fertig konfiguriert und das Standard - Passwort funktioniert noch. Da ein SIEM über einiges an Rechten in einem Netz verfügt, wäre das eine "Elevation of Privilege"

CAPEC-70

Taktik-ID: T1078
Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of existing accounts as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion. Compromised credentials may be used to bypass access controls placed on various resources on systems within the network and may even be used for persistent access to remote systems and externally available services, such as VPNs, Outlook Web Access, network devices, and remote desktop. Compromised credentials may also grant an adversary increased privilege to specific systems or access to restricted areas of the network. Adversaries may choose not to use malware or tools in conjunction with the legitimate access those credentials provide to make it harder to detect their presence.

Dread=
Damage: 9
Reproducibility: 6
Exploitability: 8
Affected users: 3
Discoverability: 10
threats.mitigation:
1. Einmal-Passwort verwenden, was sofort nach erstem eingeben geändert werden muss und alle admin PWs sicher aufbewahren. Zusätzlich zeitlimit auf OTP legen
2.
3. reproducibility, exploitability sinken
4. D3-OTP
5. 2.8.1 Verify that time-based OTPs have a defined lifetime before
expiring.
6.
